fullDescription.intro:
Create a Google Sheets connection using interactive authentication, via pop-up.
Authentication happens in the dialog. A pop-up will appear that asks the user to grant access to Google Sheets and Google Drive.
Received authentication tokens will, by default, be saved in the node. It is however possible to set a custom storage location.
Access can be revoked any time by visiting myaccount.google.com/permissions
For details see: developers.google.com/analytics/resources/concepts/gaConceptsAccounts.
fullDescription.option:
Where the credentials received during authentication should be stored.
Default
Credentials will be stored in the node settings.
Custom
User id
A user id under which the tokens should be saved. Specifying different user ids generates different credentials
Select Directory
The directory to which the credentials should be saved.
This button will open a dialog to authenticate with google services.

ports.outPort: A connection that can be used to access Google Sheets.
